title: Urim and Thummim
content: Hebrew term that means “Lights and Perfections.” An instrument prepared of God to assist man in obtaining revelation from the Lord and in translating languages. See

Using a Urim and Thummim is the special prerogative of a seer, and it would seem reasonable that such instruments were used from the time of Adam. However, the earliest mention is in connection with the brother of Jared (
). Abraham used a Urim and Thummim (
), as did Aaron and the priests of Israel, and also the prophets among the Nephites (
). There is more than one Urim and Thummim, but we are informed that Joseph Smith had the one used by the brother of Jared (
) A partial description is given in
. Joseph Smith used it in translating the Book of Mormon and in obtaining other revelations.
